Transparency.findings: New York Life provides concrete, public-facing details about its use of generative AI, including its adoption roadmap, model types, and internal AI showcases. These sources demonstrate a commitment to transparency by explaining both the strategy and practical implementation of AI technologies across the company.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: The sources provide concrete evidence that New York Life addresses fairness and bias mitigation through a human-in-the-loop approach and formal guiding principles. The company documents risk management and compliance oversight, indicating active efforts to prevent algorithmic bias in AI decision-making.

Explainability.findings: New York Life offers public explanations of its AI models and emphasizes explainability through human review of AI outputs. This approach ensures that both internal stakeholders and the public can understand how AI decisions are made and reviewed.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: Multiple sources demonstrate that New York Life maintains strong human oversight in its AI systems, including explicit human review of AI-generated outputs and executive-level discussions of accountability. These practices ensure humans remain central to critical decisions involving AI.

Governance & Accountability.findings: New York Life demonstrates a robust AI governance structure, with dedicated leadership roles, documented frameworks, and executive participation in regulatory advisory boards. summary.overallFindings: New York Life Insurance Company demonstrates comprehensive and well-documented responsible AI practices across all seven pillars. The company provides detailed public evidence of transparency, fairness, explainability, human oversight, privacy, governance, and external commitments. Its approach includes formal frameworks, leadership accountability, and active participation in industry advisory boards, reflecting a mature and robust responsible AI program.
